qas.question: Who did Spielberg begin dating in 1976?
How did Irving describe Spielberg's house?
Why did Irving not want to be in Spielberg's films while dating?

answers.text: "I don't want to be known as Steven's girlfriend,"

qas.question: In what year did Brian de Palma direct his first film?
What was the first movie Julie Phillips ever co-produced?
In what year did Amy Irving move into Spielberg's home?
Who was one of the actresses in Close Encounters?
In what year did Amy Irving move out of Spielberg's home?

context: Spielberg first met <a1_0>actress<a1_0/> <a0_0><b8_0>Amy Irving<b8_0/><a0_0/> in <b5_0><b7_0><b9_0>1976<b9_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/> at the suggestion of director <a2_0>Brian De Palma<a2_0/>, who knew he was looking for an actress to play in <b6_0>Close Encounters<b6_0/>. After meeting her, Spielberg told his co-producer Julia Phillips, "I met a real heartbreaker last night.":293 Although she was too young for the role, she and Spielberg began dating and she eventually moved in to what she described as his <a3_0>"bachelor funky"<a3_0/> house.:294 They lived together for four years, but the stresses of their professional careers took a toll on their relationship. Irving wanted to be certain that whatever success she attained as an actress would be her own: <a4_0>"I don't want to be known as Steven's girlfriend,"<a4_0/> she said, and chose not to be in any of his films during those years.:295
